intro: Anemonospermos amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping anemonosperma, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves that tightly encircle the stem, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a short, herbaceous stem. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
